intro: Hepetis cinnabarina, commonly known as the scarlet lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to the forest understory.
